abstract: If combined, the two cable operators may have enough firepower to pursue a new “friendly” consolidation with Time Warner Cable.
snippet: If combined, the two cable operators may have enough firepower to pursue a new “friendly” consolidation with Time Warner Cable.
lead_paragraph: Charter Communications announced Monday that it was going ahead with its $10.4 billion deal for Bright House Networks, signaling the start of a new push to consolidate the country’s cable operators.

headline.main: Charter and Bright House Pursuing Merger Even After Comcast’s Failed Deal
headline.print_headline: Charter and Bright House Renew Their Merger Plans
